intro: Securidaca rivinifolia var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved sand thorn, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The species is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
